contents.item: please believe that things are good with me, and even when they're not, they will be soon enough. And i will always believe the same about you.
contents.owner: Stephen Chbosky, The Perks of Being a Wallflower

contents.item: Take responsibility of your own happiness, never put it in other people’s hands.
contents.owner: Roy T. Bennett, The Light in the Heart

contents.item: It was only a sunny smile, and little it cost in the giving, but like morning light it scattered the night and made the day worth living.
contents.owner: F. Scott Fitzgerald

contents.item: I felt once more how simple and frugal a thing is happiness: a glass of wine, a roast chestnut, a wretched little brazier, the sound of the sea. Nothing else.
contents.owner: Nikos Kazantzakis, Zorba the Greek

contents.item: Now and then it's good to pause in our pursuit of happiness and just be happy.
contents.owner: Guillaume Apollinaire

contents.item: Stop comparing yourself to other people, just choose to be happy and live your own life.
contents.owner: Roy T. Bennett, The Light in the Heart

contents.item: Do not set aside your happiness. Do not wait to be happy in the future. The best time to be happy is always now.
contents.owner: Roy T. Bennett

contents.item: Stop giving other people the power to control your happiness, your mind, and your life. If you don't take control of yourself and your own life, someone else is bound to try.
contents.owner: Roy T. Bennett, The Light in the Heart

contents.item: Perfectionism is the enemy of happiness. Embrace being perfectly imperfect. Learn from your mistakes and forgive yourself, you’ll be happier. We make mistakes because we are imperfect. Learn from your mistakes, forgive yourself, and keep moving forward.
contents.owner: Roy T. Bennett, The Light in the Heart

contents.item: People are unhappy when they get something too easily. You have to sweat--that's the only moral they know.
contents.owner: Dany Laferrière, I Am a Japanese Writer

contents.item: Sadness gives depth. Happiness gives height. Sadness gives roots. Happiness gives branches. Happiness is like a tree going into the sky, and sadness is like the roots going down into the womb of the earth. Both are needed, and the higher a tree goes, the deeper it goes, simultaneously. The bigger the tree, the bigger will be its roots. In fact, it is always in proportion. That's its balance.
contents.owner: Osho, Everyday Osho: 365 Daily Meditations for the Here and Now

contents.item: Smile more. Smiling can make you and others happy.
contents.owner: Roy T. Bennett, The Light in the Heart

contents.item: A smile puts you on the right track. A smile makes the world a beautiful place. When you lose your smile, you lose your way in the chaos of life.
contents.owner: Roy T. Bennett, The Light in the Heart

contents.item: I don't think that there are any limits to how excellent we could make life seem.
contents.owner: Jonathan Safran Foer, Everything Is Illuminated

contents.item: The more you praise and celebrate your life, the more there is in life to celebrate.
contents.owner: Oprah Winfrey

contents.item: No one should ever ask themselves that: why am I unhappy? The question carries within it the virus that will destroy everything. If we ask that question, it means we want to find out what makes us happy. If what makes us happy is different from what we have now, then we must either change once and for all or stay as we are, feeling even more unhappy.
contents.owner: Paulo Coelho, The Zahir

contents.item: Nothing makes a person happier than having a happy heart.
contents.owner: Roy T. Bennett

contents.item: Happiness was but the occasional episode in a general drama of pain.
contents.owner: Thomas Hardy, The Mayor of Casterbridge

contents.item: Obscurity and a competence—that is the life that is best worth living.
contents.owner: Mark Twain, Notebook

contents.item: Pierre was right when he said that one must believe in the possibility of happiness in order to be happy, and I now believe in it. Let the dead bury the dead, but while I'm alive, I must live and be happy.
contents.owner: Leo Tolstoy, War and Peace
